intro: Linociera macrothyrsa, commonly known as the large-thyrsed linociera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
